sentence.text: They said that another friend would look after her , but when we went to see her a month later , she looked absolutely awful , in a field all on her own and full of worms .
His behaviour earlier on was absolutely awful .
` Everyone says how awful the teenage years are , and we had our share of rows and problems , but I enjoyed those years with my children -- far better than the baby or toddler stages . "
Everyone was always too busy discussing how awful the food was .
The festival 's pretty awful , so we 're entertaining each other . "
We 'd had some pretty awful weather already , but the third round was the worst of the week .
Some jokes are so awful that you should only ever tell them while you 're wearing a decent pair of trainers .
` It was so awful for all of us .
The bacon burgers were awful and the coffee was at 1000 degrees C , but that months copy of VIZ helped to pass the time .
No-one could accuse him of having a truly awful game at Windsor but we still await the ` big one " from Michael on Ulster soil .
A friend of mine had one of those awful days at work when she felt like hitting everyone and shouting at everybody in sight .
It 's been the most awful day of my life .
Was n't that just the typical end to a perfectly awful day ?
` Of course it would n't bother me ! " she replied at once , but she had the awful feeling that her denial lacked the ring of truth .
It hurt very , very badly , but what hurt most was the awful feeling of having let herself down .

She remembered the evening because his parents had given him an awful sweater for his birthday and between comedy programmes on the television she and Alan thought up alternative uses for an awful sweater .
` My husband has put a lot of work into Maastricht and the last six months have been awful for him , " she said .
It 's been awful for me and my mother , too .
It would be awful to work in a place where everyone was miserable .
I was at one of these awful prep schools , stuck in the middle of the countryside and pop music was a real lifeline .
" Oh God , that awful place in Islington , " Slater looked sympathetic .
Must be an awful job , I always think , being a guard .
So why apply , more or less , for an awful job that seriously threatens domestic harmony ?
It was the most awful moment of his life and he did n't know how to handle it .
It was typical of Hebden , Blanche thought with a cynical smile to herself , that even at that awful moment all he could think about was himself .
• What an awful series of events .
He 'll sell this -- this awful wilderness and return to his career of accountancy .

The second set began with the emphasis on theatricality in a take-off of a television talent show , in which trombonist Rick Taylor took the honours with a memorably awful rendition of The Eagles 's Desperado .
It seems awful that so often these places are the only type of indoor entertainment to keep youngsters amused .
` It 's awful when you lose a pet , but do n't forget that Brownies smile in time of trouble , and that 's just when the smile is most needed .
The world 's most awful human problem , third-world poverty , appears to have hardened the hearts of the prosperous .
` Why is he smoking , and waving his arms about in that awful way ? "
` I felt sorry for the people in the awful rain .
It is not nice living on those estates and the schools are awful . "
The fire effects were awful , very embarrassing , and due entirely to a lack of money . "
